Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jsp

Class XMLJSPParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jsp.XMLJSPParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JSPParser
    public class XMLJSPParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements JSPParser
    SAX-based parser for JSP pages in XML format (JSPX).

    This parser handles JSP pages that use XML syntax, where JSP elements are represented as XML elements with specific namespaces. For example: 

     <jsp:root xmlns:jsp="http://java.sun.com/JSP/Page" version="2.0">
   <jsp:directive.page contentType="text/html; charset=UTF-8"/>
   <html>
     <body>
       <jsp:scriptlet>
         String message = "Hello, World!";
       </jsp:scriptlet>
       <jsp:expression>message</jsp:expression>
     </body>
   </html>
 </jsp:root>

    This parser uses SAX exclusively for XML parsing. It requires a working SAX parser factory to be provided.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      XMLJSPParser()
      Creates an XML JSP parser using the default SAX parser factory.
      XMLJSPParser​(javax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory saxParserFactory)

      • parse

        public JSPPage parse​(java.io.InputStream input,
                     java.lang.String encoding,
                     java.lang.String jspUri)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     JSPParseException
        Description copied from interface: JSPParser
        Parses a JSP source file from the provided input stream and creates an abstract syntax tree representation.
        Specified by:
        parse in interface JSPParser
        Parameters:
        input - the input stream containing JSP source bytes
        encoding - the character encoding of the JSP source (e.g., "UTF-8")
        jspUri - the URI/path of the JSP file being parsed (for error reporting)
        Returns:
        a JSPPage representing the parsed JSP structure
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the input
        JSPParseException - if the JSP source contains syntax errors

      • parse

        public JSPPage parse​(java.io.InputStream input,
                     java.lang.String encoding,
                     java.lang.String jspUri,
                     JSPPropertyGroupResolver.ResolvedJSPProperties jspProperties)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     JSPParseException
        Description copied from interface: JSPParser
        Parses a JSP source file from the provided input stream using the specified JSP configuration properties. This method allows parsers to respect JSP configuration such as scriptingInvalid and elIgnored settings.
        Specified by:
        parse in interface JSPParser
        Parameters:
        input - the input stream containing JSP source bytes
        encoding - the character encoding of the JSP source (e.g., "UTF-8")
        jspUri - the URI/path of the JSP file being parsed (for error reporting)
        jspProperties - the resolved JSP configuration properties
        Returns:
        a JSPPage representing the parsed JSP structure
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the input
        JSPParseException - if the JSP source contains syntax errors or violates configuration
